page.title: 08The Development of Old Hall
page.content: It looked like the soldiers would stay for ever,but they did not.By 1950 most of the camps had disappeared and by the middle of the 60's the aircraft had gone as well.Peace and quiet returned to the area,as it was left forgotten and alone.some farming went on ,but the land was scarred by the concrete and iron left from the camps. By 1980 the population of Old Hall was practically nil with just a handful of people living in the nearby derelict houses scattered around.Then once again it all changed.More men and machines arrived.This time to build roads and houses,built by the New Town Development Corporation at Warrington.Soon there was a shop,school,community centre and public telephone.Dozens of people were moving in every week.
